name: Impeccable
description:
the sun swept current
kept us apart for so long
we had neither energy nor time
to love each other in ways 
our youth had dreamed

so we fell into each others arms
and pretended that we could fly

February 12th, 2022 / Santa Cruz Island, Santa Barbara, CA / Infrared Photography

name: New Hearts
description:
let my heart be worn soft
like denim tumbled across the sky
forgetting its place 
amongst rapture and worry

a prayer for the new wake
of cataclysmic souls
stretching mind and love
across placeless galaxies
through indescribable visions
turning without time or thought

February 11th, 2022 / Santa Cruz Island, Santa Barbara, CA / Infrared Photography

name: We Walk
description:
melt my courage into madness
sitting in the comforts of yesterday
churning through morality and novelty

foot over heel, ankle over elbow
mind over matter, though
what seems to matter
is never on my mind

produced by brainorchestra. mixed by phile
name: Dragons

description:
solitude gifted from little boxes in the sky 
selling fortune and good vibes 
to whoever has a few minutes of patience
 - or enough coffee to get through the conversation. 
(not sure what I’d rather have: patience or coffee.
especially when I’ve forgotten what you’re talking about) - 

don't be a stranger now. 
share your opinion, 
even if it's boring, and you don't know what you're talking about. 
people like that kind of stuff, 
or at least they sometimes act that way.

The bluffs at Devils Lake in Baraboo Wisconsin remind me of my childhood. We would go backpacking there once a year, until us kids got too old for family. It always felt like this mythical, far off place. The preparation and the travel truly  being the most exciting part of the journey - turns out it's only an hour drive from where we grew up - Revisiting the old memories with new eyes and grown perspectives. The world often feels much smaller than I remember, however I remember it. I didn't plan on reevaluating my place in the universe this weekend, even if I asked nicely.

Infrared Photography  / Modified Canon T2i / Kolari Vision 590nm IR filter / 24mm / f6.7 / 1/180s / ISO 100
name: A Life in the Game

description:
First pressing of original infrared photography. Exclusively on Mintbase. 

writing checks a dollar short
to put them in a long report
all the while, no one looks
counting pennies that he's took
hiding them by cupboard rags
in thirteen-gallon garbage bags
“better stuffed inside my sheets
than rolling down the city streets”

and so castles in the sand
are washed out to sea eventually 

Taken on a Canon T2i with infrared filter modification, 590 nm "super color". 
July 2020 at Laurelwood Arboretum in Wayne, NJ 

PNG for download is 4838 × 3456 (5:7)
name: Castles in the Sand

description:
a portrait of new york city during the covid19 pandemic

we stood and watched 
while soho lay dreaming
streets filled with people like sand
falling through your fingertips
leaving as quietly as they came
